text:
that it does look like standardizing the dataset prior to modeling does result in a small lift in
performance from about 90.4% accuracy (close to what we saw in the previous section) to about
91.5% accuracy.
Note: Given the stochastic nature of the algorithm, your speciﬁc results may vary. Consider
running the example a few times.
>p=False #1: 91.483
>p=False #2: 91.245
>p=False #3: 90.838
>p=False #4: 89.243
>p=False #5: 90.193
>p=False #6: 90.465
>p=False #7: 90.397
>p=False #8: 90.567
